Description:
JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work.  Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESClient/Stakeholder ManagementProvide superior customer service to meet on-site client’s expectations
Act as an Ambassador for the JLL and Philips brands supporting and promoting client experience on site and act as the trusted partner for Philips
Be visibly engaged in the workplace and act as the firs point of contact for issues and troubleshooting.Procurement & Vendor ManagementAssist in the management of all contractors on site to ensure they perform to the required standards (including inspection of vendors’ works).
Attend monthly vendor meetings
Monitor and maintain office, badge, tea and coffee consumables stock.
Oversee and order stationery when necessary.Finance ManagementAssist in financial processes to ensure that all financial management requirements are completed in a timely and accurate manner
Work with JLL vendors to resolve invoice issues in a timely manner and report solutions to finance teams
Use account tooling to record & report on spend and ensure spend with vendors remains in line with budget expectations and present figures at monthly meetings
Ensure prompt and accurate management of purchase orders in JDE including creation of Purchase request forms and completion of goods receiving processesHealth & Safety ManagementEnsure all JLL contractor management processes are performed including but not limited to securing RAMS from vendors, spot checks, permits and site orientations.
Assist in carrying out safety procedures when needed and having knowledge of emergency evacuation procedures as well as general Health & Safety.
Completion of GEMBA walks and JLL HSSE inspections and reports.
Reporting all good catches, near misses and incidents on the appropriate platformSite Operations ManagementCoordination of on-site JLL activities – arrange for contractors to attend locations responsible as per our service agreements.
Assist in the implementation of Industry Best Practice operations
Conduct site inspections, GEMBA walks and assessments to ensure all building procedures and performance measures are always maintained.
Seek ways to constantly reduce costs and improve operational standards
Ensure premises are always maintained by vendors in neat and good working condition
Attend appropriate meetings with JLL management and colleaguesReception supportSupport with reception cover greeting, assisting, and directing candidates, new hires, visitors, and general public to the right person in the company.
Receive, direct and relay telephone, email, and other queries.
Maintain the visitor sign-in book - and vendors - and a general filing system of correspondence, contacts, and deliveries.
Assist with travel arrangements for Philips staffRisk ManagementFollow established escalation procedures and incident reporting procedures
Adhere to JLL’s business conduct by ensuring compliance with the firm’s guidelines, procedures, and strategies
Achieve Key Performance Indicators and Service Level Agreement targets
Assist in all needed reporting (client and JLL internal)SecurityManagement of all the access of the building
Support creation of the entrance/access badge for new employees (or renewals). 
Back up for the visitor badges (in case reception is closed)
Demonstrate a permanent high level of security awareness and emergency evacuation procedures.
Issue badge access or print badge for employees/loaner, new hires, vendors, and visitors, maintaining record of sameMailManage incoming and outgoing mail / parcels / packages (transportation, check-in, material filing).
Ensure the sorting, processing, and transmission of incoming mail, whether it is paper or dematerialized
Receive registered mail, sign acknowledgements of receipt and forward them to the appropriate person, to the departments concerned.ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITESSupport the wider JLL & Philips team.
As front-line employee, act as an ambassador of the IFM program.
Ensure accurate and detailed hand over is planned & passed on (for tasks for which being responsible), if absent from the business.
Attend all meetings as requiredAny other reasonable activity that is requestedSkillsFluency in local language and high/intermediate level in English language with excellent verbal & written communication skills.
Proficient with the use of Microsoft suite.
Knowledge of local occupational health and safety requirements, critical facilities and vendor management for specialized services is advantageous
Understanding of basic technical aspects of property (Computer Room Air-conditioning, Chiller system, Fire Protection system, Mechanical & Electrical system, BMS system) is advantageous
Problem-solving skills – capacity to deal with ambiguity and solve complex problems effectively
The ability to effectively deal with stressful situations
The ability to work independentlyCompetenciesStrong Client and Customer Focus & Relationship Management
Self-motivated; confident & energetic
Flexible – able to adapt to rapidly changing situations
Goal-oriented – able to focus on meeting all performance targetsExperiencePrior experience in facilities, property management, hospitality or related field (preferred)QualificationsHospitality or Hotel Management/Vocational /education

A Fortune 500 company with annual revenue of $20.9 billion and operations in over 80 countries around the world, our more than 103,000 employees bring the power of a global platform combined with local expertise.
